lines.content: This is Duke bro, your friendly task assistant.
Run the jar file and you're good to go. Enter "help" in the dialog box and bro will tell you all the commands.
Your tasks will be saved in {somewhere}/data/duke.txt.
* This file was generated by the Gradle 'init' task.
* This is a general purpose Gradle build.
* Learn more about Gradle by exploring our samples at https://docs.gradle.org/7.3.3/samples

### Keep track of your tasks with BroDuke.
Create, delete, and mark your todos/deadlines/events.
Just use the find command with a search phrase.
### Maintain your list of tasks in storage between sessions.
Save data will be saved at {duke_directory}/data/duke.txt
All commands are text-based and should be typed into the input field. Here are some example commands:
### `deadline` - create a new task with a deadline
### For a comprehensive list of all features, use the `help` command.

* Notifies the user upon task successfully deleted and prints the number of tasks in the list.
* Prints a goodbye message to the user.

* Prints all the tasks in the list of tasks.
return "Here are your tasks bro:\n" + tasks;
* Informs the user that there are no tasks.
return "There are no tasks yet, bro.";
* Notifies the user upon task successfully marked.
return "Ok bro, marked this task:\n" + task;
* Notifies the user upon task successfully unmarked.
return "Ok bro, unmarked this task:\n" + task;

return "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n" + results;
